message.content:
cs.DB, cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT 

This paper discusses techniques for privacy-preserving data mining, which is a topic that falls under several CS sub-categories. The most likely category is cs.DB (Databases), as the paper focuses on preserving client privacy in the data mining process. The second likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), as the paper proposes a novel perturbation mechanism that improves privacy. The third likely category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), as the paper discusses the design of perturbation mechanisms for accurate mining results. The fourth likely category is cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), as the paper evaluates the utility of the proposed framework for frequent-itemset mining on real datasets. The fifth likely category is cs.IT (Information Theory), as the paper proposes a matrix-theoretic model of random perturbation.
